prompt.preamble:
We are testing a system for understanding people's interest in reading different kinds of online articles.
For example, you might be interested in articles about some topics, but not about others.
prompt.task_description: your preferences of what kinds of online articles you would like to read
prompt.final: In the final part of the study, you will give feedback on a test set of article headline and descriptions, which will enable us to see how well a chatbot reading your responses has learned what you like and dislike.
prompt.evaluation: Please indicate whether you would like to read the following articles: "yes" if you would, "no" if you would not.

test_samples:
Website Name: New York Times
Title: In Norway, the Electric Vehicle Future Has Already Arrived
Description: About 80 percent of new cars sold in Norway are battery-powered. As a result, the air is cleaner, the streets are quieter and the grid hasn’t collapsed. But problems with unreliable chargers persist.

Website Name: TIME Magazine
Title: Two Coronations, 70 Years Apart
Description: The Visual Parallels Between Elizabeth II and Charles III's Coronations

Website Name: The Atlantic
Title: What Does Sentience Really Mean?
Description: The fact that AI isn’t alive doesn’t mean it can’t be sentient, the sociologist Jacy Reese Anthis argues.

Website Name: Bon Appetit
Title: Bon Appetit's Best Banana Bread Recipe
Description: After baking 14 loaves, we aligned on this tender, ultra-moist banana bread as our collective favorite.

Website Name: National Geographic
Title: There’s a new way to tour the Amazon rainforest: by crane
Description: Canopy cranes, once reserved for treetop research, let you see the “eighth continent” like an arbornaut.

Website Name: Travel and Leisure
Title: These Airlines Have the Most Luxurious Economy Seats
Description: You can find good Champagne, amenity kits, hot towel service, and wider seats in the economy cabin — if you know where to look.

Website Name: Popular Science
Title: The right amount of online scrolling could decrease your risk of dementia
Description: A new demographic survey indicates a potential link between regular internet usage and cognitive health in older populations.

Website Name: Rolling Stone
Title: All of Nintendo’s Zelda Games, Ranked
Description: From NES to Switch, our picks for the best legends in the 35-year-old iconic adventure saga.

Website Name: Sports Illustrated
Title: 2024 NFL Draft: The Six Players Fans Need to Know, Including Caleb Williams
Description: Quarterbacks will dominate the top 10, but the son of a former Hall of Fame receiver will be picked in the top five, too, along with another dominant Alabama defensive player.

Website Name: Architectural Digest
Title: Hang On, Is Artificial Grass Actually Chic?
Description: Designers discuss why faux lawns are more popular than you think.

Website Name: Esquire
Title:The Best Summer Songs of 2023
Description: A sunny mix of 10 hits to carry you through the season.

Website Name: Sunset Magazine
Title: 31 Perfect Recipes for Mother’s Day Brunch.
Description:Make mom’s day extra-special with an elegant homemade brunch. We’ve got your menu covered, from mains to drinks to dessert.

Website Name: Vogue
Title: 40 Minimalist Earrings to Wear Now and Forever
Description: From classic hoops to sculptural drops, these are the earrings you’ll never want to take off.

Website Name: Runner's World
Title: How to Prevent Running Injuries Before They Sideline You
Description: All the tips you need to keep running strong, including strength and mobility moves.

Website Name: Forbes
Title: Killing It
Description: How Two Failed Entrepreneurs Suddenly Began Making Millions Selling Murder Mysteries

Website Name: Tricycle: The Buddhist Review
Title: Why We Look for Happiness in the Wrong Places
Description: Meditation teacher Sharon Salzberg discusses how our yearning for happiness can support us in our journey toward freedom—and why we tend to search for it in the wrong places.
